32.heading: Dubose, Dub.
32.title: "There's a Lot to Learn from Watchin' Somebody Mow a Lawn!"
32.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Kudzu asks Uncle Dub to babysit Doris while he mows the lawn; Doris ends up riding on the mower handle.

33.heading: Dubose, Kudzu.
33.title: "Carried Away with a Love Letter"
33.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Ida Mae invites Kudzu to the dental office so she can show him the proper way to floss.
Key words: Water pics, dental floss, molars, cavities, gum disease.

34.heading: Dubose, Kudzu.
34.title: "The City of My Dreams!"
34.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Kudzu can't believe he's really in New York City, the Big Apple, and then he steps in something.

35.heading: Dubose, Kudzu.
35.title: "It's a Dogma-Eat-Dogma World!"
35.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Kudzu talks about holy wars and inquisitions in the name of religion, and Rev. Done responds.
Key words: Dog-eat-dog, Protestants, Catholics, Muslims, Jews.

36.heading: Dubose, Kudzu.
36.title: "Pining Away for Kudzu Dubose"
36.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Ida Mae Wombat reads her essay about her Summer vacation, which included computer camp, selling dental floss door-to-door, rushing the stage when Leonard Nimoy appeared at an sf convention in Atlanta, and writing Kudzu's name in magic markers all over her loose-leaf notebook.

37.heading: Dubose, Kudzu.
37.title: "There's a Lot to Learn from Watchin' Somebody Mow a Lawn!"
37.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Kudzu asks Uncle Dub to babysit Doris while he mows the lawn; Doris ends up riding on the mower handle.

38.heading: Dubose, Kudzu.
38.title: "Think of Me When You Use It"
38.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Kudzu wants no gifts, but Ida Mae gives him a token of her devotion: dental floss.

39.heading: DuBose, Kudzu.
39.title: "What Are You Driving At?"
39.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Veranda has turned Kudzu down for dates 739 times, and sics her Dobermans on him, but he doesn't get it.

78.heading: Duchâteau, André-Paul, 1925-
78.title: "Le Français Errant"
78.author: Denayer ; A
78.appears_in: P. Duchâteau. 3 p. in Tintin, ann. 35, no. 19 (May 6, 1980).
notes: "Résumé: Chez Fulgura, les rumeurs de fermeture vont bien train. Pour sauver l'usine, Serge, le mécanicien et patron, a réalisé un nouveau protype selon lui 'révolutionnaire,' mais comme son pilot, Alain Chevallier, a refusé de l'essayer, ne l'estimant pas suffisamment au point, il l'a congédié."

79.heading: Duchâteau, André-Paul, 1925-
79.title: "Le Français Errant"
79.author: Denayer ; A
79.appears_in: P. Duchâteau. 4 p. in Tintin, ann. 35, no. 20 (May 13, 1980).
notes: Résumé: Alain Chevallier, qui vient d'apprendre la mort tragique de son oncle au volant du prototype Fulgura quie lui-même avait refusé de piloter à cause de ses défauts de conception, revit la dernière conversation qui l'a opposé à Serge."

80.heading: Duchâteau, André-Paul, 1925-
80.title: "Le Français Errant"
80.author: Denayer ; A
80.appears_in: P. Duchâteau. 3 p. in Tintin, ann. 35, no. 21 (May 20, 1980).
notes: "Résumé: Errant sans but à travers le pays à la suite de l'annonce de la mort tragique de son oncle, Alain Chevallier se trouve bientôt aux prises avec une bande de motards, 'la bande à Crazy,' que la petite amie d'un de ses membres vient, sous ses yeux, de décider de quitter, au term d'une action d'éclat."

81.heading: Duchâteau, André-Paul, 1925-
81.title: "Le Français Errant"
81.author: Denayer ; A
81.appears_in: P. Duchâteau. 3 p. in Tintin, ann. 35, no. 22 (May 27, 1980).
notes: "Résumé: Le jour se lève sur Hialeah Speedway, le matin de la course. Là se retrouvent la 'bande à Crazy' et, bien sûr, Alain Chevallier, qu'accompagne 'Honey,' la fille que notre ami a tirée des pattes de la bande des motards."
